title: Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient
name: VisionClient
description:
Google Cloud Vision allows you to understand the content of an image, classify images into categories, detect text, objects, faces and more. Find more information at the Google Cloud Vision docs.

Please note this client will be deprecated in our next release. In order to receive the latest features and updates, please take the time to familiarize yourself with Google\Cloud\Vision\V1\ImageAnnotatorClient.

methods.name: __construct
methods.description:
Create a Vision client.

Note that when creating a VisionClient instance, setting $config.projectId is not supported. To switch between projects, you must provide credentials with access to the project.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: A hostname with optional port to use in place of the service's default endpoint.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

methods.name: image
methods.description:
Create an instance of Google\Cloud\Vision\Image with required features and options.

This method should be used to configure a single image, or when a set of images requires different settings for each member of the set. If you have a set of images which all will use the same settings, Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient::images() may be quicker and simpler to use.

This method will not perform any service requests, and is meant to be used to configure a request prior to calling Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient::annotate().

For more information, including best practices and examples detailing other usage such as $imageContext, see Google\Cloud\Vision\Image::__construct().

params.name: image
params.description: An image to configure with the given settings. This parameter will accept a resource, a string of bytes, the URI of an image in a publicly-accessible web location, or an instance of Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: features
params.description: A list of cloud vision features to apply to the image.

params.name: options
params.description: See Google\Cloud\Vision\Image::__construct() for configuration details.

methods.name: images
methods.description:
Create an array of type Google\Cloud\Vision\Image with required features and options set for each member of the set.

This method is useful for quickly configuring every member of a set of images with the same features and options. Should you need to provide different features or options for one or more members of the set, Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient::image() is a better choice.

This method will not perform any service requests, and is meant to be used to configure a request prior to calling Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient::annotateBatch().

For more information, including best practices and examples detailing other usage such as $imageContext, see Google\Cloud\Vision\Image::__construct().

examples.caption: In the example below, both images will have the same settings applied. They will both run face detection and return up to 10 results.

params.name: images
params.description: An array of images to configure with the given settings. Each member of the set can be a resource, a string of bytes, the URI of an image in a publicly-accessible web location, or an instance of Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: features
params.description: A list of cloud vision features to apply to each image.

params.name: options
params.description: See Google\Cloud\Vision\Image::__construct() for configuration details.

params.name: image
params.description: The image to annotate

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options

params.name: images
params.description: An array consisting of instances of Google\Cloud\Vision\Image.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options
